fields.headline: Organ grinder
fields.bodyText: · Anyone but Davina !! Writerman · Oh come on - Davina would be brilliant - and while we're at it let's change the name to Celebrity Island Discs - take the whole thing up market! starstruck · Penelope Keith in character as Margo from The Good Life - she's the only woman in history that could be more condescendingly hideous than Sue "please don't let anyone know I'm a Brummie" Lawly. pootie · Silvio Berlusconi ... Significant Other · Why not use some imagination and create a new programme. Desert Island Discs is badly worn and mainly a vehicle for wannabee nonentities these days. Let us join the 21st century.Terry Lee · Hasn't anyone considered Anna Ford? She is free soon, and her dulcet tones and journalistic background would make her ideally placed to present this show.Philip · Surely the kids from PopWorld are looking for jobs.Sam · Maybe a long shot but what about John Inverdale. I've been impressed with him on Radio 2 this week and he has a very calm interviewing style. Could be worth a punt as he's a good BBC name.themanwhois · If the BBC's prediliction for giving extra jobs to anyone from BBC News (Dermot M on BBC2 quiz, N Kaplinsky, er anywhere, Dimbleby Picture of Britain, the sad chap off Breakfast who ended up on Strictly Come Dancing, Fiona Bruce Crimewatch) is anything to go by, it has to be . . . Andrew Marr! davebrubeck · what about dale winton? he's a real people person who could add a bit of much needed fizz to the show! robin · Karl Pilkington - surely the obvious choice for both BBC people and Guardian readers. nick peters · It has to be Sue MacGregor. Her voice was made for radio. Peter Jenkins · Clearly me ... I nicked Roy's idea recently for my own radio prog and called it My Perfect Day. I broadcast out of St. Kitts & Nevis in the eastern caribbean and it goes down well. happydollar
